context.p: A classifier creates conditions for filtering and classifying data sources. If no conditions are specified, all of the data sources are considered for classification. You can filter data sources by an expression (email, Peer to Peer), protocol or subscriber attribute, for example. These filters are also called "classifier conditions".

step.info: All Classifiers that have been defined will be accessible for selection in the Classifiers view.

step.cmd: To add a classifier, click Classify.
Enter a name and description for the classifier.

substep.cmd: Enumerated: All possible values of the classifier must be specified in the definition
Integer: Classifier can be assigned any integer value
String: Classifier can be assigned any string value.

step.cmd: Set up one or more rules for the classifer, then click Next.

info.p: Rules are conditions that, if met, set values for the classifers.

step.cmd: (Optional) Set target(s) for the classifier (which nodes this classifer is available for).

info.p: If no targets are set, then the classifier is available for all elements on all nodes.

step.cmd: Define additional Classifiers by selecting Customize Classifiers option.
Remove old alarms and filter match items.
step.info: It is a best practice to remove old alarms or filter match items when they are no longer needed. Failure to regularly remove old alarms or filter match items may result in inconsistent reporting results.

substep.cmd: Select Filter match items that no longer apply and that you wish to remove.

substep.stepresult: The old alarms and filter match items will be removed.

taskbody.result: Classifiers have been added to data sources. They can be used to filter and analyze data received from these sources. You can follow the same procedures to change existing Classifiers or to add new ones.
